visualization_prompt: Generate an interactive areaspline chart showing weekly fruit consumption trends with temporal progression using animated time control sliders
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional temporal-categorical data tracking 9 sequential weeks (n=9 observations) with daily consumption measurements (7 ordinal categories). Synthetic data maintains domain validity through constrained integer values (1-12 units) and demonstrates two statistical patterns: 1) Gradual weekly increase (μ=3.14→9.29 units) showing consumption growth 2) Weekend peaks (Saturday/Sunday values 10-30% higher than weekly averages. The areaspline visualization maximizes data-ink ratio by using continuous opacity gradients for trend observation while maintaining categorical boundaries. Cairo's principles are applied through: 1) Pre-attentive hue differentiation (green actual vs red average) 2) Proportional area encoding 3) Direct temporal labeling. Synthetic anchors: Weekly data follows Poisson distribution (λ=5), average series maintains μ=6.86 (σ=0.69) representing stable baseline consumption.
